snippet: Regulators, led by the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, are said to be close to taking action against JPMorgan Chase for insufficient safeguards.
abstract: Federal and state authorities, led by Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, are investigating a handful of major American banks for failing to monitor cash transactions in and out of their branches, lapse that may have enabled drug dealers and terrorists to launder tainted money; investigation had previously focused only on European banks.

byline.original: By JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG and BEN PROTESS

lead_paragraph: Regulators, led by the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, are said to be close to taking action against JPMorgan Chase for insufficient safeguards.

headline.seo: Money-Laundering Inquiry Said to Target U.S. Banks
headline.main: Money-Laundering Inquiry Is Said to Aim at U.S. Banks
headline.print_headline: Money-Laundering Inquiry Said to Be Looking Into U.S. Banks

keywords.value: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
keywords.name: organizations
